ADV205.name: Principles of Advertising
ADV205.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV205.description: Principles and practices of advertising in relation to economies, societies, and mass communication.

ADV210.name: Concept Development
ADV210.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV210.description: Forming visual ideas with a strong narrative. Conceptualizing solutions that meet strategic advertising objectives from idea generation to the final application, regardless of media type.
ADV210.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising Creative major.

ADV222.name: Introduction to Copywriting
ADV222.description: Role of copywriting in the creative process. Iconic advertising campaigns with copywriting emphasis. Practice in writing copy with critique and rewriting. Focus on writing for print media.
ADV222.prerequisite: (ADV 205 and (ADV 210 or concurrently)) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
ADV222.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising Creative major or approval of department.

ADV224.name: Introduction to Creative Media
ADV224.description: Communication design principles used by art directors for research, exploration, and execution. Visual communication solutions using design principles with the appropriate digital technology. Design software includes Adobe CC Illustrator, Photoshop and Indesign.
ADV224.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising Creative major.

ADV225.name: Writing for Public Relations
ADV225.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV225.description: Theory and practice of preparing written business communications.
ADV225.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the James Madison College or in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of department.

ADV245.name: Multimedia Commercial Production
ADV245.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV245.description: Cinematography applied to 15-, 30- and 60-second spots for TV, desktop and handheld devices. The power of story telling in the production of screen-based creative advertising solutions including motion graphics and animation. Planning, writing, casting, filming, editing, sound, lighting, and evaluation.
ADV245.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising Creative major.

ADV260.name: Principles of Public Relations
ADV260.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV260.description: Role and function of public relations in society. History of the field. Roles of practitioners and understanding the unique professional areas within the field of public relations.

ADV322.name: 360-degree Copywriting
ADV322.description: Writing across multiple channels. Focus on traditional media including television, print, out-of home, and radio. Focus on non-traditional media including digital and social media.
ADV322.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising Creative major.

ADV326.name: Advanced Creative: Media I
ADV326.description: Applications of creative media to advertising. Design principles that enable art directors to organize information on page or screen to communicate the client's message clearly and imaginatively.
ADV326.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising Creative major.

ADV330.name: Advertising Management Strategy
ADV330.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV330.description: Advertising problems from the perspective of managers responsible for solving problems. Identify problems, develop alternative solutions, implement effective strategies, and evaluate proposed solutions.
ADV330.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations.

ADV334.name: International Advertising
ADV334.description: Advertising decisions and consumer behavior. Political systems, literacy rates, new technologies, consumer behavior, and culture. Decision making, strategy, media selection, creative execution and campaign evaluation.
ADV334.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Advertising major or approval of department.

ADV342.name: Account Planning and Research
ADV342.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV342.description: Principles of account planning. Strategic thinking, use of focus groups, and other qualitative and quantitative methods. Applied media research methods, practices, techniques and ethics in media settings.
ADV342.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Advertising major.

ADV350.name: Advertising Media Planning and Strategy
ADV350.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV350.description: Introduction to advertising media planning. Characteristics of media, media terminology and calculations. Use of syndicated media research and development of media plans.
ADV350.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Advertising Major.

ADV352.name: Media Sales
ADV352.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV352.description: Process of media sales, operation of sales and marketing departments, analyzing local media, and customized advertising using cross-selling.
ADV352.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations.

ADV354.name: Interactive Advertising Design
ADV354.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV354.description: Build interactive websites that are adaptable to any screen size. Apply concepts like information architecture, the grid system, an web design principles when developing websites.
ADV354.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising Creative major.

ADV360.name: Advanced Sales Communication
ADV360.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV360.description: Need-based selling and leadership role in meeting client needs. Advanced methods of questioning, customer need analysis, negotiation, effective presentations and interpersonal communication relationships with clients. Sales role-playing presentations, business and technical writing, portfolio presentations, and case studies.
ADV360.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Sales Communication Specialization.

ADV375.name: Consumer Behavior
ADV375.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV375.description: Theories of consumer behavior and their applications to promotions disciplines. Using theories to solve problems and make managerial decisions faced by practitioners in advertising agencies, suppliers, and client side marketing functions.
ADV375.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors.

ADV386.name: Campaign Competition
ADV386.description: Research, analyze, develop, and execute an integrated marketing and advertising campaign for selected client. Written recommendations and presentations for competition.

ADV401.name: Neuromarketing and Consumer Decisions
ADV401.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV401.description: Exploration of the field of neuromarketing, including different methodological techniques. Examination of how the human brain makes consumer decisions. Discern valid from invalid neuromarketing practices.

ADV402.name: Public Relations Topics in Advertising
ADV402.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV402.description: Current topics related to the practice of public relations.
ADV402.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Public Relations Specialization. A student may earn a maximum of 6 credits in any or all enrollments in ADV 402, COM 402, or JRN 402.

ADV413.name: Issues in Contemporary Advertising
ADV413.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV413.description: Current issues in advertising and related disciplines.

ADV420.name: New Media Driver's License
ADV420.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV420.description: Digital communication for advertising and public relations. Using new media, including social media, to effectively market a business or individual to a target audience.
ADV420.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors.

ADV422.name: Advanced Copywriting: Creating Experiences
ADV422.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV422.description: Continued development of aesthetic and technical copywriting skills to develop ads and multi-media campaigns that solve advertising problems; emphasis on creating relevant audience experiences and self-critiquing.
ADV422.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising Creative major or approval of department.

ADV428.name: Advanced Creative: Media II
ADV428.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV428.description: Creative execution skills to explore the power of branding. Visual solutions that reinforce the brand experience through ads, campaigns, and collateral material. Creative research, strategy development.
ADV428.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising Creative major.

ADV430.name: Social Marketing: Strategy and Practice
ADV430.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV430.description: Use of marketing concepts and tools from sociology, psychology, commercial marketing, and public opinion research to promote individuals' pro-social and health behaviors. Application of strategies that improve quality of life and result in behavioral and societal changes in positive ways.
ADV430.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations or in the Department of Communication and open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Marketing.

ADV431.name: Monitoring and Measuring Social Media of Brands
ADV431.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV431.description: Social media monitoring and analysis for businesses and brands including advanced keyword building and search techniques. Discovering business insights through social media listening and applying insights through a social media response plan.
ADV431.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations or in the Sports Business Management Minor.

ADV432.name: Digital Media Planning and Buying
ADV432.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV432.description: Media planning and buying for web-based business applications. Budget-building, media mix recommendations, performance analysis, and support for business decisions.
ADV432.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations.

ADV433.name: Internet Video Promotion Strategy
ADV433.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV433.description: Promotional video production focusing on brands or companies. Use of metrics and analytical tools to determine impact of promotional video. Video distribution strategies.

ADV436.name: Promotions and Sponsorships
ADV436.description: Corporate communication activities used to elicit consumer response to a product and service mix. Non-traditional advertising strategies, cross-promotion strategies, and strategies for non-profit organizations.
ADV436.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Advertising major or in the Retailing major or in the Food Industry Management major.

ADV442.name: Digital Analytics
ADV442.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV442.description: Data collection, analysis and reporting on cross- or multi-channel media analytics in order to inform strategic advertising and public relations decision making. Evaluate impact of integrated communication decisions.
ADV442.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations.

ADV445.name: Programmatic Media Buying
ADV445.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV445.description: Background, processes, and applications of how online advertising and public relations campaigns are planned, booked, optimized, and validated using programmatic tools. Developments and trends in programmatic advertising platform tests and entries into mainstream media channels. Targeted offers, messages, content or ads across paid, owned and earned channels.
ADV445.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations.

ADV450.name: Portfolio Presentation
ADV450.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV450.description: Editing past work for professional presentation. Strengthening, expanding, and finalizing individual portfolios for career enhancement. Critique by professionals.
ADV450.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising Creative major.

ADV455.name: Intensive Portfolio Workshop
ADV455.description: Create portfolio works across various platforms (print and screen) that meet current industry standards. Teams of student art directors and copywriters collaborate to generate advertising solutions.
ADV455.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors. Approval of department; application required.

ADV456.name: Interactive Advertising Management Strategy
ADV456.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV456.description: Theory and practice of interactive advertising, e-commerce, Internet advertising, online sales promotion, online public relations, virtual communities, and Internet research. Role of strategy in implementing interactive solutions.
ADV456.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations.

ADV475.name: Advertising and Society
ADV475.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV475.description: Impact of advertising on society, culture and economy. Representation of minorities, women, and the elderly in advertising; free speech, advertising law, and regulatory organizations; ethical decision making strategies; and advertising's economic role in information, competition, price, and product choice.
ADV475.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations.

ADV481.name: Retail Strategy Analysis
ADV481.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV481.description: Strategic and financial planning for retailers.
ADV481.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations or in the Sales Leadership Minor or in the Retail Management Minor or approval of department.

ADV486.name: Integrated Campaigns (W)
ADV486.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV486.description: Development of integrated marketing and advertising campaigns for clients. Creative, media and marketing communication elements.
ADV486.prerequisite: {(CAS 110 and ADV 342) and (ADV 330 or ADV 350) and ((ADV 442 or concurrently) or (ADV 450 or concurrently))} or (ADV 325 and completion of Tier I writing requirement)
ADV486.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations or in the Public Relations Minor.

ADV490.name: Independent Study
ADV490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV490.description: Supervised individual study in an area of advertising or public relations.
ADV490.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students. Approval of department; application required.

ADV492.name: Special Topics in Advertising
ADV492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV492.description: Varied topics pertaining to the study of advertising and public relations processes.

ADV493.name: Advertising and Public Relations Internship
ADV493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV493.description: Supervised experience in a professional environment.
ADV493.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations. Approval of department; application required.

ADV494.name: Practicum in Research/Creative Works and Instruction
ADV494.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV494.description: Structured participation in departmental research teams/creative work, classroom management and applied practice in the community.
ADV494.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations. Approval of department.

ADV803.name: Introduction to Quantitative Research Methods
ADV803.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
ADV803.description: Introduction to quantitative social science research methods and applied analyses for understanding research reports and developing graduate level research projects.

ADV816.name: Fundraising and Philanthropy in Nonprofit Organizations
ADV816.description: Principles, function, practice, ethics, and process of fundraising and philanthropic development. Societal role of nonprofit organizations.
ADV816.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences.

ADV823.name: Consumer Behavior Theories
ADV823.description: Concepts and theories from behavioral sciences applied to consumer decision making. Application of theories to develop consumer behavior research studies, advertising and public relations programs. Interpersonal and mass communication applied to consumer decision making.

ADV826.name: Advertising and Promotion Management
ADV826.description: Planning promotional strategy. Establishing policies for decision-making. Execution and evaluation of advertising and sales promotion programs. Emphasis on case analysis.
ADV826.prerequisite: MKT 805 and ADV 823 and (COM 803 or concurrently)

ADV830.name: Seminar in Social Marketing
ADV830.description: In-depth reading and critical thinking about theories and principles in social marketing. Application of theory and empirical research to evaluating and planning social marketing programs.

ADV836.name: Media Innovations
ADV836.description: Alternative methods of advertising. Effects of non-traditional advertising strategies on consumers. Theoretical and methodological approaches.

ADV843.name: Strategic Brand Communication
ADV843.description: Brand communication research and strategy. Applications to new media and technology. Innovation and brand development, emphasizing futures research and perceptual mapping.

ADV846.name: Media Strategy
ADV846.description: Planning, execution, and control of media programs. Theory and techniques of budget allocation including marginal analysis, mathematical programming, simulation and game theory.

ADV850.name: Public Relations Management
ADV850.description: Managing public relations campaigns and programs, including research, planning, implementation, and evaluation. Using theory and practice to design strategic public relations programs for clients or sponsoring organizations

ADV855.name: Public Relations Theories
ADV855.description: Evolving and relevant theories drawn from psychology, communication, sociology, education and management that guide research and inform the management function of effective public relations counseling.

ADV860.name: Media Relations
ADV860.description: Theory and practice of how public relations professionals work with the news media to communicate with external publics.

ADV865.name: Advertising and Society
ADV865.description: Impact of advertising on individuals, society, and the economy. Public policy issues relevant to advertising. Regulation by government and industry.

ADV870.name: International Advertising
ADV870.description: International dimensions of advertising and other marketing communications. Comparative analysis of economic, cultural, and legal conditions that affect advertising activities. International and foreign media.

ADV890.name: Independent Study
ADV890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV890.restrictions: Open to graduate students. Approval of department.

ADV892.name: Special Topics
ADV892.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV892.description: Emerging topics in advertising and public relations.

ADV893.name: Practicum
ADV893.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV893.description: Supervised experience in advertising and/or public relations settings.
ADV893.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Advertising and Public Relations or approval of department.

ADV899.name: Master's Thesis Research
ADV899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV899.restrictions: Open to students in the Advertising major or in the Public Relations Major.

ADV900.name: Theory Building in Media and Information Studies
ADV900.description: Concepts and issues relating explanation, scientific inquiry, theory building and applications to interdisciplinary studies in media and information.

ADV916.name: Qualitative Research Methods
ADV916.description: Qualitative research in mass and specialized communication systems. Topics include documentary, bibliographic, case study and participant observation methods.
ADV916.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences.

ADV921.name: Theories of Media and Information
ADV921.description: Overview of the relations between information theory, communication theory, and media theory, and an understanding of how these theories have evolved over time and which competing approaches coexist.
ADV921.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.

ADV960.name: Media and Technology
ADV960.description: Theoretical frameworks concerning media and communication processes, and their interactions with technology. Social, organizational, critical, and economic perspectives.
ADV960.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Communication Major or in the Media and Information Studies Major or approval of department.

ADV975.name: Introductory Methods
ADV975.description: A survey of qualitative and quantitative research design including validity and reliability, hypothesis formation, sampling, ethics, survey, experimental, ethnographic, observational and mixed methods.

ADV985.name: Advanced Quantitative Analysis for Media
ADV985.description: Multivariate research methods for media and information studies research.

ADV990.name: Independent Study
ADV990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV990.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.

ADV991.name: Ways of Knowing
ADV991.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV991.description: Ways humans acquire, convey, organize and shape knowledge and information, and are shaped and influenced by it. Neurological, psychological linguistic, philosophical, cultural, and logical dimensions of human knowledge.
ADV991.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.

ADV992.name: Doctoral Seminar
ADV992.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ADV992.description: Topics on theoretical and research issues in communication and mass media.
ADV992.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.

ADV993.name: Research Practicum in Information and Media
ADV993.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ADV993.description: Directed research collaboration with a faculty member or a team of students/faculty.
ADV993.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.
